lead_paragraph: A report by the Syrian Center for Policy Research said life expectancy in Syria had dropped 14 years and put the war’s economic cost at $255 billion.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Gaziantep; Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; and Maher Samaan from Paris.

headline.print_headline: Death Toll in Syria War at 470,000, Report Says
headline.main: Death Toll From War in Syria Now 470,000, Group Finds

snippet: A report by the Syrian Center for Policy Research said life expectancy in Syria had dropped 14 years and put the war’s economic cost at $255 billion.
abstract: Syrian Center for Policy Research reports death toll from five-year conflict stands at 470,000, much higher than previous estimates; study, released as Russian and American diplomats jointly propose peace process, also says war has cost $255 billion and reduced Syrian's life expectancy by 14 years.
